body.p: Axons of parasympathetic preganglionic neurons travel from the brainstem or from the lateral horn of sacral levels of the spinal cord to postganglionic neurons

response.feedback: Correct. Parasympathetic preganglionic neurons have long axons that project to the postganglionic neurons located locally near or within the target organ, gland, or tissue.
Incorrect. Axons of preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system travel relatively long distances to their target organs and tissues.

part.hint: Sympathetic preganglionic neurons have relatively short axons.

body.p: Axons of sympathetic preganglionic neurons travel to postganglionic neurons

response.feedback: Incorrect. Axons of preganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system travel relatively short distances to their corresponding postganglionic neurons.

Correct. Sympathetic preganglionic neurons have relatively short axons that project to the postganglionic neurons located in sympathetic chain ganglia or collateral (prevertebral) ganglia located at some distance from the target organ, gland, or tissue.

part.hint: Sympathetic preganglionic neurons have relatively short axons.
